remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve been experiencing dizziness and difficulty standing up. Can you describe in more detail how your dizziness feels—does it come on suddenly, is it constant, or does it get worse with certain movements?

remedi_labels.value: Hello, thank you for coming in today.

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, yeah, thanks for seeing me. Well, the main thing is I’ve just been really dizzy—like, I’ll try to stand up and it feels like the room is spinning. It’s kind of sudden, I guess. And, uh, I’ve also got this headache that just won’t go away, even when I take something for it. Should I be worried?

remedi_labels.value: headache does not go away even after taking medicine

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious—sudden dizziness and a persistent headache can be very unsettling. To help guide my assessment, can you tell me if you’ve experienced any weakness, numbness, or changes in your ability to move your arms or legs since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: changes in ability to move arms or legs

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, yeah, actually—when I tried to reach for the railing earlier, my arm just wouldn’t move right. It kind of freaked me out. The dizziness is still the main thing, though.

Thank you for explaining that—sudden weakness in your arm along with dizziness is important for me to understand. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any numbness, tingling, or weakness in your legs or other parts of your clinical examination since these symptoms started?

remedi_labels.value: sudden weakness in arm along with dizziness
numbness, tingling, or weakness in legs or other parts

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… yeah, I think there’s been some tingling in my left leg, and maybe a bit of weakness too. Honestly, I haven’t really been able to stand up without feeling like I might fall over. And, like I said, my arm just wouldn’t move when I tried to grab the railing. It’s making me pretty anxious, to be honest.

remedi_labels.value: difficulty standing without feeling like might fall
left arm would not move when trying to grab railing

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious—sudden weakness and difficulty standing are concerning symptoms. To help with my assessment, did you experience any changes in your speech, vision, or facial movements when your arm wouldn’t move or when you felt unable to stand?

Um, let me think… I don’t think my speech changed or anything like that. My vision was a little blurry for a bit, but it kind of cleared up after I sat down. No drooping or anything on my face that I noticed. The dizziness almost felt like vertigo, you know? And this headache—it’s been pretty bad, kind of reminds me of the headaches I used to get about 12 years ago, but this one just won’t go away. That’s making me more worried, honestly.

I can understand why you’d be worried—persistent dizziness, weakness, and a severe headache are concerning symptoms. To help with my assessment, have you experienced any loss of consciousness, confusion, or difficulty understanding speech during these episodes?

Um… actually, yeah, I think I might’ve blacked out for a second—like, I don’t really remember what happened right after I got dizzy. Is that what you’d call syncope? I didn’t feel confused after, but it was kind of scary. And with this headpain, I keep worrying—could this be something serious, like a subarachnoid hemorrhage? Or am I just overthinking it because I’m anxious?

I can completely understand why you’re experiencing anxious—experiencing sudden weakness and not being able to stand up is understandably frightening. To help with my assessment, when your arm would not move while reaching for the railing, did you also notice any loss of sensation or inability to control fine movements in your hand or fingers?

remedi_labels.value: loss of sensation in hand or fingers
inability to control fine movements in hand or fingers

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Yeah, um, now that you mention it, I did notice some numbness in my hand—like, my fingers felt kind of tingly and I couldn’t really grip anything. It was almost like my hand wasn’t listening to me, if that makes sense. The fine movements were definitely off. Is that something you see with, uh, neurological symptoms? I’m just worried because with the dizziness, the syncope, and this headache that won’t go away, it feels like a lot all at once. Should I be concerned about something like a stroke or a subarachnoid hemorrhage?

I can understand why you’d be worried—experiencing sudden numbness, weakness, and difficulty with fine motor control in your hand, along with dizziness and headache, are all important neurological symptoms. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any changes in your ability to feel sensations such as temperature or pain in your arm or leg since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: difficulty with fine motor control in hand
changes in ability to feel sensations such as temperature or pain in arm or leg
